Engage with AI@VA

There are several ways to get involved with the AI work happening at VA!

We are building communities for AI professionals, scientists, clinicians and others interested in AI to learn and share about artificial intelligence. For individuals just learning about AI, all the way to AI experts, we encourage you to join us in building the future of AI at VA and beyond.​

Subscribe to the AI@VA Community newsletter for updates about events, competitions, industry news and opportunities to engage!

Subscribe

AI Tech Sprints

The AI Tech Sprints are a series of competitions hosted by the VA National Artificial Intelligence Institute (NAII). Through a three-month competitive engagement, teams strive to provide a new approach to innovation to meet Veteran needs. The competitions encourage collaboration between industry, academia and VA, as participants create AI-enabled tools that leverage federal data to address specific Veteran health care issues.​

During the 2022 AI Tech Sprint, teams worked to produce prototype learning platforms for the All Services Personnel and Institutional Readiness Engine (ASPIRE) project with mentors from many federal agencies and AI experts to create or refine a computer-based platform to test and train users in important tech skills. The ultimate goal is to create a testing and training system that will be used across the federal workforce. ​

Click here to learn more about the AI Tech Sprints.

2022 BRAIN Summit, click here.

AI Summit Series

NAII launched the AI Summit Series in 2022 to bring together AI professionals and stakeholders to address the various ways AI can improve health outcomes and health care services for Veterans and the public.

The inaugural event of the series, the Brain Health and Rehabilitation through Artificial Intelligence Network (BRAIN) Summit, highlighted how AI is impacting three areas of critical importance to Veteran health: brain cancer, traumatic brain injury (TBI) and rehabilitation, and mental health.​

More than 500 attendees gathered to hear about the potential of AI regarding Veteran health care, including how the technology can help with suicide prevention, applying AI learning to address TBI and brain cancer, and emerging applications and AI regulation.​
